p: Both pretreatments induced an increase in glucan content from 41% in untreated samples to 47% ( p < 0.001) and 44% ( p = 0.002) in the HW- and IL-pretreated samples, respectively. HW pretreatment also induced a decrease of the hemicelluloses content from 22% down to 8% which resulted in an increase of the relative amount of lignin (from 24% up to 33%). IL pretreatment only induced a small decrease in hemicelluloses content down to 19% while the lignin content remained unchanged [ 13].
